00050 /************ INLINE function for General command ***********/
00051 INLINE void vmeio_intsync_set(DWORD base_adr, DWORD pattern)
00052 /**************************************************************\
00053  Purpose: Set VMEIO interrupt source to be sync mode.
00054           Each bit refers to an input (0:7)
00055           If not set the interrupt source is Async
00056  Input:
00057   DWORD * base_addr     : base address of the VMEIO
00058   DWORD pattern         : data to be applied to board
00059  Output:
00060     none
00061  Function value:
00062     none
00063 \**************************************************************/
00064 {
00065    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00066 
00067    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (SET_INT_SYNC);
00068    *spec_adr = (pattern & 0xf);
00069 }
00070 
00071 /************ INLINE function for General command **********/
00072 INLINE void vmeio_pulse_set(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD pattern)
00073 /**************************************************************\
00074  Purpose: Set VMEIO output channel pattern to be pulse mode
00075           Each bit refers to an output (0:23)
00076           If not set the output is latch mode
00077  Input:
00078   DWORD * base_addr     : base address of the VMEIO
00079   DWORD pattern         : data to be applied to board
00080  Output:
00081     none
00082  Function value:
00083     none
00084 \**************************************************************/
00085 {
00086    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00087 
00088    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (SET_PULSE);
00089    *spec_adr = (pattern & 0xffffff);
00090 }
00091 
00092 /************ INLINE function for General command **********/
00093 INLINE void vmeio_sync_read(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD * data)
00094 /**************************************************************\
00095  Purpose: read VMEIO sync input data if gate received
00096  Input:
00097   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the VMEIO
00098   DWORD * data            : data to be read
00099  Output:
00100     none
00101  Function value:
00102     none
00103 \**************************************************************/
00104 {
00105    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00106    DWORD status;
00107 
00108    /* status : Check first if trigger has been received */
00109    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (READ_STATUS);
00110    status = *spec_adr;
00111    status &= 0xf;
00112    if (status != 0) {
00113       spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (READ_SYNC);
00114       *data = (*spec_adr & 0xffffff);
00115    } else
00116       *data = 0x80000000;
00117 }
00118 
00119 /************ INLINE function for General command **********/
00120 INLINE void vmeio_async_read(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD * data)
00121 /**************************************************************\
00122  Purpose: read VMEIO async input data
00123  Input:
00124   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the VMEIO
00125   DWORD * data            : data to be read
00126  Output:
00127     none
00128  Function value:
00129     none
00130 \**************************************************************/
00131 {
00132    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00133 
00134    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (READ_ASYNC);
00135    *data = (*spec_adr & 0xffffff);
00136 }
00137 
00138 /************ INLINE function for General command **********/
00139 INLINE void vmeio_pulse_write(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD data)
00140 /**************************************************************\
00141  Purpose: write to VMEIO pulse output.
00142           only the pulse enable channels will be affected
00143           Each bit correspond to a output (0:23)
00144  Input:
00145   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the VMEIO
00146   DWORD data              : data to write
00147  Output:
00148     none
00149  Function value:
00150     none
00151 \**************************************************************/
00152 {
00153    DWORD *spec_adr;
00154 
00155    /* status : Check first if trigger has been received */
00156    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 | base_adr) + (WRITE_PULSE);
00157    *spec_adr = (data & 0xffffff);
00158 }
00159 
00160 /************ INLINE function for General command **********/
00161 INLINE void vmeio_latch_write(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD data)
00162 /**************************************************************\
00163  Purpose: write to VMEIO latch output.
00164           only the latch enable channels will be affected
00165           Each bit correspond to a output (0:23)
00166  Input:
00167   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the VMEIO
00168   DWORD data              : data to write
00169  Output:
00170     none
00171  Function value:
00172     none
00173 \**************************************************************/
00174 {
00175    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00176 
00177    /* status : Check first if trigger has been received */
00178    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (WRITE_LATCH);
00179    *spec_adr = (data & 0xffffff);
00180 }
00181 
00182 /************ INLINE function for General command **********/
00183 INLINE void vmeio_clear(const DWORD base_adr)
00184 /**************************************************************\
00185  Purpose: clear the status reg (strobe)
00186  Input:
00187   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the VMEIO
00188  Output:
00189     none
00190  Function value:
00191     none
00192 \**************************************************************/
00193 {
00194    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00195 
00196    /* status : Check first if trigger has been received */
00197    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (CLEAR_VMEIO);
00198    *spec_adr = 0x0;
00199 }
00200 
00201 /************ INLINE function for General command **********/
00202 INLINE void vmeio_status_read(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD * data)
00203 /**************************************************************\
00204  Purpose: read the status register.
00205           contains the strobe bit (0x1), the interrupt level (0x70)
00206  Input:
00207   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the VMEIO
00208   DWORD * data            : status
00209  Output:
00210     none
00211  Function value:
00212     none
00213 \**************************************************************/
00214 {
00215    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00216 
00217    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (READ_STATUS);
00218    *data = (*spec_adr & 0xff);
00219 }
00220 
00221 /************ INLINE function for Interrupt handling **********/
00222 INLINE void vmeio_int_clear(const DWORD base_adr)
00223 {
00224    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00225 
00226    /* status : Check first if trigger has been received */
00227    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (CLEAR_VMEIO);
00228    *spec_adr = 0x0;
00229 }
00230 
00231 INLINE void vmeio_int_enable(const DWORD base_adr, int intnum)
00232 /**************************************************************\
00233  Purpose: Enable the interrupt for the bitwise input intnum (0xff).
00234           The interrupt vector is then the VECTOR_BASE+intnum
00235  Input:
00236   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the VMEIO
00237   DWORD * intnum          : interrupt number (input 0:7)
00238  Output:
00239     none
00240  Function value:
00241     none
00242 \**************************************************************/
00243 {
00244    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00245 
00246    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (ENABLE_INT);
00247    *spec_adr = (intnum & 0xff);
00248 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00249    sysIntEnable(7);             /* interrupt level 7 */
00250 #endif
00251 }
00252 
00253 INLINE void vmeio_int_disable(const DWORD base_adr, int intnum)
00254 /**************************************************************\
00255  Purpose: Disable the interrupt for the bitwise input intnum (0xff).
00256           The interrupt vector is then the VECTOR_BASE+intnum
00257  Input:
00258   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the VMEIO
00259   DWORD * intnum          : interrupt number (input 0:7)
00260  Output:
00261     none
00262  Function value:
00263     none
00264 \**************************************************************/
00265 {
00266    volatile DWORD *spec_adr;
00267 
00268 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00269    sysIntDisable(7);            /* interrupt level 7 */
00270 #endif
00271    spec_adr = (DWORD *) (A32D24 + base_adr) + (ENABLE_INT);
00272    *spec_adr = ~(intnum & 0xff);
00273 }
00274 
00275 INLINE void vmeio_int_attach(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD base_vect, int intnum,
00276                              void (*isr) (void))
00277 /**************************************************************\
00278  Purpose: Book an ISR for a bitwise set of interrupt input (0xff).
00279           The interrupt vector is then the VECTOR_BASE+intnum
00280  Input:
00281   DWORD * base_addr      : base address of the VMEIO
00282   DWORD base_vect        : base vector of the module
00283   DWORD intnum           : interrupt number (0:7)
00284   DWORD isr_routine      : interrupt routine pointer
00285  Output:
00286     none
00287  Function value:
00288     none
00289 \**************************************************************/
00290 {
00291    vmeio_int_clear(base_adr);   /* clear any pending front panel interrupts */
00292    vmeio_int_disable(base_adr, intnum); /* bitwise input */
00293 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00294    if (intnum < 8)
00295       intConnect(INUM_TO_IVEC(base_vect + intnum), (VOIDFUNCPTR) isr, intnum);
00296 #else
00297    printf("vector : 0x%x\n", base_vect + intnum);
00298 #endif
00299    vmeio_int_enable(base_adr, intnum);  /* bitwise input */
00300 }
00301 
00302 INLINE void vmeio_int_detach(const DWORD base_adr, DWORD base_vect, int intnum)
00303 /**************************************************************\
00304  Purpose: Unbook an ISR for a bitwise set of interrupt input (0xff).
00305           The interrupt vector is then the VECTOR_BASE+intnum
00306  Input:
00307   DWORD * base_addr       : base address of the VMEIO
00308   DWORD base_vect        : base vector of the module
00309   DWORD intnum           : interrupt number (0:7)
00310  Output:
00311     none
00312  Function value:
00313     none
00314 \**************************************************************/
00315 {
00316    vmeio_int_clear(base_adr);   /* clear any pending front panel interrupts */
00317    vmeio_int_disable(base_adr, intnum); /* mask off external interrupt x */
00318 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00319    if (intnum < 8)
00320       intConnect(INUM_TO_IVEC(base_vect + intnum), (VOIDFUNCPTR) myStub, intnum);
00321 #else
00322    printf("vector : 0x%x\n", base_vect + intnum);
00323 #endif
00324 }

00326 /*-Tests---------------------------------------------------------*/
00327 void vmeio(void)
00328 {
00329    printf("\n---> vmeIO Triumf board 24bit in/out latch/pulse + 8 interrupts <---\n");
00330    printf("Inline: vmeio_intsync_set (base, pattern)  : set interrupt source\n");
00331    printf("Inline: vmeio_pulse_set   (base, pattern)  : set output pulse\n");
00332    printf("Inline: vmeio_sync_read   (base, *data)    : read sync input\n");
00333    printf("Inline: vmeio_async_read  (base, *data)    : read Async input\n");
00334    printf("Inline: vmeio_pulse_write (base, data)     : write pulse output\n");
00335    printf("Inline: vmeio_latch_write (base, data)     : write latch output\n");
00336    printf("Inline: vmeio_clear       (base)           : clear strobe\n");
00337    printf("Inline: vmeio_status_read (base, *status)  : read status register\n");
00338    printf("Inline: vmeio_int_clear   (base)           : clear interrupts\n");
00339    printf("Inline: vmeio_int_enable  (base, int#)     : enable interrupt (0:7)\n");
00340    printf("Inline: vmeio_int_disable (base, int#)     : disable interrupt (0:7)\n");
00341    printf("Inline: vmeio_int_enable  (base, int#)     : enable interrupt (0:7)\n");
00342    printf("Inline: vmeio_int_attach  (base, vec, int#, isr) : interrupt (0:7)\n");
00343    printf("Inline: vmeio_int_detach  (base, vect, int#) : interrupt (0:7)\n");
00344    printf("Test  : vmeio_Status_read (0x780000)       : display status\n");
00345    printf("Test  : vmeio_Async_read  (0x780000)       : read Async\n");
00346    printf("Test  : vmeio_Sync_read   (0x780000)       : read sync\n");
00347    printf("Test  : vmeio_Pulse_write (0x780000,       : write pulse\n");
00348    printf("Test  : vmeio_Latch_write (0x780000,       : write latch\n");
00349    printf("Test  : vmeio_Clear       (0x780000)       : clear VMEIO\n");
00350    printf("Test  : Interrupt : VMEIO_BASE: 0x780000, VMEIO_VECT_BASE: 0x7F\n");
00351    printf("Test  : The interrupt test is based on the following configuration:\n");
00352    printf("        Output 0 -> strobe\n");
00353    printf("        Output 1 -> Input 0\n");
00354    printf("        Output 2 -> Input 1\n");
00355    printf("        Output 3 -> Input 2\n");
00356    printf("        vmeio_attach_async_interrupt(1)  will enable I1\n");
00357    printf("        vmeio_gen_async(1)               will generate int in I1\n");
00358    printf("  or    vmeio_attach_sync_interrupt(1)   will enable I1\n");
00359    printf("        vmeio_gen_sync(1)                will generate int in I1\n");
00360    printf("Test  : vmeio_attach_async_interrupt( x...): attach, enable Int#\n");
00361    printf("Test  : vmeio_attach_sync_interrupt( x...) : attach, enable Int#\n");
00362    printf("Test  : vmeio_detach_interrupt( x...)      : detach, enable Int#\n");
00363    printf("Test  : vmeio_gen_async( x)                : generate a Async int\n");
00364    printf("Test  : vmeio_gen_sync( x)                 : generate a sync int\n");
00365 }

00367 #define VMEIO_BASE  0x780000    /* VMEIO base address */
00368 #define VMEIO_VECT_BASE 0x7f
00369 
00370 void vmeio_Status_read(DWORD base)
00371 {
00372    char str[5];
00373    DWORD status, pattern;
00374    vmeio_status_read(base, &status);
00375    printf("vmeio status :0x%x\n", status);
00376    pattern = status & 0xff;
00377    printf("Status vmeio ==> intsrc:%s / Strobe:%1.1x\n",
00378           (((pattern & 0xf0) >> 4) == 0 ? strcpy(str, "ASync") : strcpy(str, "Sync"))
00379           , (pattern & 0x1));
00380 }
00381 
00382 void vmeio_Async_read(DWORD base)
00383 {
00384    DWORD status;
00385    vmeio_async_read(base, &status);
00386    printf("vmeio Async data :0x%x\n", status);
00387 }
00388 
00389 void vmeio_Sync_read(DWORD base)
00390 {
00391    DWORD status;
00392    vmeio_sync_read(base, &status);
00393    printf("vmeio Sync data :0x%x\n", status);
00394 }

00396 void vmeio_Pulse_write(DWORD base, DWORD pat)
00397 {
00398    vmeio_pulse_write(base, pat);
00399 }

00401 void vmeio_Latch_write(DWORD base, DWORD pat)
00402 {
00403    vmeio_latch_write(base, pat);
00404 }

00406 void vmeio_Clear(DWORD base)
00407 {

00410 
00411 /* the interrupt test is based on the following configuration:
00412    O0 -> strobe
00413    O1 -> I0
00414    O2 -> I1
00415    O3 -> I2
00416    
00417    vmeio_attach_async_interrupt(1)
00418              will enable I1
00419    vmeio_gen_async(1)
00420              will generate int in I1
00421 
00422    vmeio_attach_sync_interrupt(1)
00423              will enable I1
00424    vmeio_gen_async(1)
00425              will generate int in I1
00426 */
00427 
00428 
00429 void vmeiotint(void)
00430 {
00431    static int vmeio_private_counter = 0;
00432 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00433    logMsg("%vmeiotint external interrupt #%i received and served\n",
00434           vmeio_private_counter++, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00435 #endif
00436 }
00437 
00438 void vmeio_attach_async_interrupt(DWORD vmeioint)
00439 {
00440    vmeio_int_disable(VMEIO_BASE, vmeioint);
00441    vmeio_intsync_set(VMEIO_BASE, 0x0);
00442    vmeio_pulse_set(VMEIO_BASE, 0x0);
00443    vmeio_int_attach(VMEIO_BASE, VMEIO_VECT_BASE, vmeioint, vmeiotint);
00444    vmeio_int_enable(VMEIO_BASE, vmeioint);
00445    printf("Please generate an interrupt on line %d\n", vmeioint);
00446 }
00447 
00448 void vmeio_gen_async(DWORD intnum)
00449 {
00450    vmeio_Latch_write(VMEIO_BASE, (intnum << 1));
00451    vmeio_Latch_write(VMEIO_BASE, 0);
00452    vmeio_intsync_set(VMEIO_BASE, 0x0);  /* reset interrupt */
00453 }
00454 
00455 void vmeio_gen_sync(DWORD intnum)
00456 {
00457    vmeio_Pulse_write(VMEIO_BASE, (0x1 | (intnum << 1)));
00458    vmeio_clear(VMEIO_BASE);     /* reset interrupt */
00459 }
00460 
00461 void vmeio_attach_sync_interrupt(DWORD vmeioint)
00462 {
00463    vmeio_intsync_set(VMEIO_BASE, (0x1 | (vmeioint << 1)));
00464    vmeio_pulse_set(VMEIO_BASE, (0x1 | (vmeioint << 1)));        /* strobe done by intput 0 */
00465    vmeio_int_disable(VMEIO_BASE, vmeioint);
00466    vmeio_int_attach(VMEIO_BASE, VMEIO_VECT_BASE, vmeioint, vmeiotint);
00467    vmeio_int_enable(VMEIO_BASE, vmeioint);
00468    printf("Please generate an interrupt on line %d\n", vmeioint);
00469 }
00470 
00471 void vmeio_detach_interrupt(DWORD vmeioint)
00472 {
00473    vmeio_int_disable(VMEIO_BASE, vmeioint);
00474    vmeio_int_detach(VMEIO_BASE, VMEIO_VECT_BASE, vmeioint);
00475    printf("Interrupt on line %d detached \n", vmeioint);
00476 }
